Inhaling through the nose draws in pure qi; exhaling through the mouth expels turbid qi. The myriad flavors and five pungent foods that one consumes all bear mutual restraint and harm, corroding the five viscera and giving rise to ailments. When the pure is mixed with the turbid, the pure becomes obscured—hence the need to expel the turbid qi through exhalation. Once the turbid is fully expelled, allow the heart-qi to enter and exit solely through the nose. The qi that moves in and out through the nose is light and pure, and the light and pure qi is yang. The qi that moves in and out through the mouth is heavy and turbid, and the heavy and turbid qi is yin.

The nose is the Gate of Heaven; the mouth is the Door of Earth. The mouth connects to the five viscera, and what issues from the five viscera is nothing but foul and turbid qi. The nose connects to the six bowels, and what issues from the six bowels is nothing but light and pure qi. The paths of pure and turbid are distinct, each following its own course. Thus, allow only the qi in the nose to come and go, lest the turbid qi contaminate the pure. When drawing qi through the nose, it must be slow and continuous, so subtle that the ear cannot perceive it—this is the essential subtlety. Let the light and pure qi circulate through the five viscera, nourishing the constructive and protective qi to permeate the entire body, opening the four limbs and all joints, dissolving stagnation, and ensuring unimpeded flow.

If the qi flows freely in and out through the Gate of Heaven, it cannot traverse the hundred passages and limb-joints. Therefore, the in-and-out flow must be continuous and unbroken. Once the turbid has been fully expelled, close the Door of Earth and leave open the Gate of Heaven, allowing spirit and qi to guard each other, embracing only the primordial yang—this is the Way of Guarding the One. Wait until the hundred vessels and bone-joints are unobstructed, all joints open, and the flow smooth and unimpeded. Then take the refined essence of the myriad flavors and five pungent foods, refine it into spirit-water, and replenish the primordial palace as treasure—this is the principle of withdrawal and replenishment.

To "take" means to draw the essence of the myriad flavors and five pungent foods generated by the spleen-viscera, guiding the true qi of primordial yang so that spirit and qi follow the constructive and protective qi in circulation. From the spine’s pass, it ascends to the front of the brain, reaching the crown of the head before returning downward. The true qi descends into the mouth, where it is rinsed and swallowed, entering the twelve-storied tower (the throat), passing into the lungs, then transmitted to the kidneys, from the kidneys to the liver, from the liver to the heart, and from the heart to the spleen. What the spleen receives is free from the harm of mutual restraint. All things are generated, entering the primordial palace to nourish the spirit-tortoise. The spirit-tortoise then produces white cinnabar, which ascends to the tongue and undergoes the threefold generation and restraint of the five phases. The five phases’ generation and restraint transform into spirit-water, which, through three and five refinements, becomes a treasure. No longer transmitted to the viscera, it is conveyed solely to the heart.

The heart has three hairs and seven orifices, with another cavity called the Saliva-Gathering Cavity. It has three orifices, and the saliva is transmitted from the central orifice to the left and right orifices of the viscera, then distributed into the skin, transforming into constructive and protective qi. When the circulation of the celestial cycle is complete, it transforms into blood; blood into flesh, flesh into sinews, sinews into bones, bones into marrow, and marrow into essence. Refined and returned to the primordial palace as treasure, this is the true One—gold within water. This gold undergoes three cycles of the five phases’ generation and restraint, hence called the Three-Five-One. Refined into a single qi, it is thus named the One.

Moreover, three represents wood, corresponding to spring, when all things arise. Wood is yang, Heaven. Five represents earth, from which all things are born. Earth is yin, Earth. The essence of wood-qi refines within earth, and earth refines the essence of wood into the supreme treasure—this is the Three-Five-One. The Three-Five-One is the subtle mechanism of Heaven and Earth, the wondrous principle of bodily generation. One who grasps this mechanism can transcend the mundane and enter sagehood, ascending to the immortal realms.

**Question:** How does one investigate the establishment of the human body, which originates from the formless and imageless? From whence does it arise?

**Answer:** It arises from the union of dragon and tiger, the merging of lead and mercury—no small matter. The great Dao of Heaven, Earth, and the myriad things is completed through the mutual resonance of qi in the central origin, forming the bodily structure. As for the root origin of dragon and tiger, within the six directions, nothing exists apart from this. One who grasps this true root origin sees the path to immortality as clearly as the palm of one’s hand.

Moreover, the dragon generates mercury, and the tiger generates lead. When true lead and true mercury subdue each other, the Dao aligns naturally. Simply follow the method of lead and mercury in cultivation, and there will be no deviation. The explanations of dragon, tiger, lead, and mercury will be expounded below.

**Question:** I wish to hear the wondrous principle of purifying the true.

**Answer:** The preceding text urges one to investigate the root origin and cultivate according to the original source. Now, humans are transformed from the true qi of father and mother. Wood is the father of humans; earth is the mother. The true qi of father and mother transforms and becomes human—this is the Three-Five-One, the true root origin of bodily existence. Simply ensure the five viscera are in harmony, the constructive and protective qi flow smoothly, and all illnesses are absent. Thereafter, cultivate the body, and there will be no deviation.

**Question:** Since humans are transformed from the true qi of father and mother, subtly seizing the creative power of Heaven and Earth to become human, why not cultivate according to the original root origin? Instead, one seizes the true qi of yin and yang, the creative power of Heaven and Earth, to refine the body—thereby attaining immortality without fail. Further, when investigating the root origin of bodily form, all structures are complete, and after three hundred days of qi sufficiency, one descends into the world as a human infant. East and west are not yet distinguished, nor south and north separated. By what method is the body established? By what qi is it nourished?

**Answer:** The infant is free from thought and worry, attachment and desire. Beyond hunger and cold, there is nothing else. Thus, spirit is settled and qi is tranquil, gradually attaining extraordinary sageliness to establish the body.

chunks.original_text: 只此法也，得气者，得母积乳之气也，是人本出於阴阳二气，二气者，四象也。 一气生二象，二象生四象，交加於中宫，故备五行，五行共聚，夺天地造化成人，三十日内，立就乾坤世界，於母双乳下生金液之津，取用为食，余者留于积乳，三百日积乳九重，此降世而要食用此积乳之气，自然增长。 学人若达三百日天地造化之大功者，但依本法而修，自然达於神仙，超凡入圣。 若要修身者，但依本法，先令气顺，无诸疾病，便乃修身。 修身者，岂忘元基哉！ ．所有修身结气之功，一切细微妙用机法，并是玄奥之机，述在后卷。 问曰：上文举凡夫欲养命，先须修身，去除疾病，令人将津液炼为神水，返炼神水为宝，宝者药也，元宫有药，有病自除，遂便依法而修其津液。 津液又不能为神水，神水又不能为至宝，惟当法不正，惟当错用功。 答 曰：法无不正，功亦不错，盖五藏真气，未能相顺，故致如斯。 但先将五藏真气，制令相顺，五藏真气顺，则将津液三返，炼为神水，神水返炼为药。 若五藏气逆於荣卫，亦不能顺行，更何况炼气为宝乎！ 问曰：五藏如何得气顺，愿闻法要。 答曰：内即五藏，外即五行，但究五行元立之机，依法元立而用修五藏，自然相顺也。 五行者，金木水火土也。 木者，位居甲乙，纯行阳道，生自丙寅，卦主震，其象青龙也。 谓自水而得气，故象青龙也。 气数九九，气足即生火，其治丙丁，火数二，卦主为离，其象朱雀，离中阴也。 阴者为受青龙之气也。 此二象，只是一气，木是主，火为用也。 金者，位处西方庚辛，纯行阴道，生自壬申，卦主为兑，其象白虎也。 为从土而得气，故象是虎也。 气数七，七气足，合得水，其治壬癸，气数五，卦主为坎，其象玄武，坎中阳也。 阳者，为受白虎之精也。 此二象，只是一气，金即为主，水即为用也。 金木水火，若成四象，遇土而相生，不遇土而相克。 土者，处於中央戊己，是帝之位。 土数五 ，具五德，旺於四季，解制四象，其气能生杀万物，故云土者，是五行之首也。 五行者，盖从阴阳所出，人之五藏，岂离於父母所生？ 当本受於父母精血，二气交感，被土制之，方乃成形。 父精者，真木火也，母血者，真金水也。 母之元宫者，真土也，金木水火被土制之，不能散失，各具本性，生性意智慧而具四象，配入中央，乃立五行。 五行即五藏，方可生万物。 万物者，即是人之筋骨皮毛，以及万神，故得俱备成人。 人若能返取阴阳真气，合造化修摄於身，何虑不作神仙也？ 已上并略言之，此是五藏所得之位也。 但却依此根本而修，必得五藏相顺，有病自除，既能无病，方可修身。 身既得金，然后养命，无不致神仙也。 问曰：五行根源所立，并知子细，如何是修五藏之法？ 答曰：夫修五藏真气者，须见五行之的，稍不精研，徒劳施工，无由得遂也。 五行之实的者，於九窍内验之，事无不准也。 何以知之？ 绿五藏外通九窍，肝通於两目，心通於舌，脾通於口，肺通於鼻，肾通於耳，下通於二阴，共为九窍，九窍既有滞，则知五藏不顺也。 五藏和平，而气无滞，则九窍俱通利，既无壅滞，即便无病，既无疾病，即便无死，既是不死，即便长生，此是於九窍中验也。

This is the method: to obtain qi is to receive the qi of the mother’s accumulated milk. Humans fundamentally emerge from the yin and yang qi, and these two qi constitute the Four Images. One qi generates the Two Images, the Two Images generate the Four Images, which intermingle within the Central Palace, thus completing the Five Phases. The Five Phases gather together to seize the creative power of Heaven and Earth, forming a human. Within thirty days, the world of Qian and Kun is established. Beneath the mother’s twin breasts, the golden fluid essence is produced, taken as nourishment, while the remainder accumulates in the stored milk. Over three hundred days, the stored milk forms nine layers. Upon descending into the world, one must consume this stored milk’s qi, which naturally fosters growth.

If a practitioner comprehends the great work of Heaven and Earth’s creation over three hundred days and cultivates according to this original method, they will naturally attain the state of immortality, transcending the mundane to enter sageliness. Should one wish to refine the body, they must first follow this method to harmonize the qi, eliminating all illnesses before proceeding to refine the body. In refining the body, how could one forget the original foundation?

All the subtle and wondrous techniques of refining the body and gathering qi are profound mysteries, which will be expounded in later volumes.

**Question:** The preceding text states that for ordinary people seeking to nourish life, one must first refine the body, eliminate illness, and transform saliva into divine water, then refine this divine water into treasure. This treasure is the medicine; when the original palace contains medicine, illness naturally vanishes, and one may proceed to refine the saliva accordingly. Yet saliva cannot become divine water, nor can divine water become the supreme treasure—only when the method is incorrect or the effort misapplied.

**Answer:** The method is never incorrect, nor is the effort misapplied. It is merely that the true qi of the Five Viscera has not yet harmonized, leading to such outcomes. One must first regulate the true qi of the Five Viscera to ensure their harmony. Once the true qi of the Five Viscera is harmonized, the saliva can be refined three times into divine water, and the divine water further refined into medicine. If the qi of the Five Viscera rebels against the constructive and defensive qi, it cannot flow smoothly—how much less can one refine qi into treasure?

**Question:** How can the qi of the Five Viscera be harmonized? I wish to hear the essential method.

**Answer:** Internally, there are the Five Viscera; externally, the Five Phases. By investigating the foundational mechanism of the Five Phases and cultivating the Five Viscera according to this principle, they will naturally harmonize. The Five Phases are Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth.

Wood resides in the positions of Jia and Yi, purely following the Yang path. It is born from Bing Yin, governed by the trigram Zhen, and its image is the Azure Dragon. It is said to receive qi from Water, hence its image as the Azure Dragon. Its qi number is nine times nine; when qi is sufficient, it generates Fire. Its governance lies in Bing and Ding, with Fire’s number being two, governed by the trigram Li, its image the Vermilion Bird—a Yin within Li, which receives the qi of the Azure Dragon. These Two Images are but one qi: Wood is the essence, Fire the function.

Metal resides in the western positions of Geng and Xin, purely following the Yin path. It is born from Ren Shen, governed by the trigram Dui, and its image is the White Tiger. It receives qi from Earth, hence its image as the Tiger. Its qi number is seven; when seven qi are sufficient, they unite to form Water. Its governance lies in Ren and Gui, with Water’s qi number being five, governed by the trigram Kan, its image the Dark Warrior—a Yang within Kan, which receives the essence of the White Tiger. These Two Images are but one qi: Metal is the essence, Water the function.

When Metal, Wood, Water, and Fire form the Four Images, they generate one another in the presence of Earth but overcome one another in its absence. Earth resides in the central positions of Wu and Ji, the imperial throne. Earth’s number is five, possessing the Five Virtues. It flourishes in the four seasons, resolves the constraints of the Four Images, and its qi can give life to or destroy all things. Thus, Earth is the chief of the Five Phases.

The Five Phases emerge from Yin and Yang, and how could the Five Viscera of humans be separate from what their parents have bestowed? One’s original endowment from the parents’ essence and blood, when the two qi intermingle, is governed by Earth to form the body. The father’s essence is true Wood-Fire, the mother’s blood is true Metal-Water. The mother’s original palace is true Earth. Metal, Wood, Water, and Fire, governed by Earth, cannot dissipate; each retains its nature, generating the faculties of intent, wisdom, and perception, thus possessing the Four Images. These are aligned with the center to establish the Five Phases. The Five Phases are the Five Viscera, which can then generate the myriad things. The myriad things are the human’s sinews, bones, skin, hair, and the ten thousand spirits—thus, all are complete to form a human.

If one can reverse and seize the true qi of Yin and Yang, uniting with the creative power to refine the body, how could one not become an immortal? The above is a brief explanation of the positions attained by the Five Viscera. By cultivating according to this foundation, the Five Viscera will naturally harmonize, illness will vanish, and once free of disease, one may refine the body. Once the body attains Metal, one may then nourish life—there is no failure in attaining immortality.

**Question:** The root source of the Five Phases has been detailed, but what is the method for refining the Five Viscera?

**Answer:** To refine the true qi of the Five Viscera, one must grasp the essence of the Five Phases. Without precise study, effort is wasted, and success remains unattainable. The true essence of the Five Phases can be verified within the nine orifices, and nothing deviates from this principle.

How is this known? The Five Viscera externally connect to the nine orifices: the liver to the two eyes, the heart to the tongue, the spleen to the mouth, the lungs to the nose, the kidneys to the ears and the two lower yin orifices—together forming the nine orifices. If the nine orifices are obstructed, it indicates the Five Viscera are not harmonized. When the Five Viscera are at peace and the qi flows without obstruction, the nine orifices are all unobstructed. Without blockage, there is no illness; without illness, there is no death; without death, there is longevity. This is the verification through the nine orifices.

chunks.original_text: 三机 初机之法共五篇阴阳等三元四象，五行生数成数，气数气候，分三等，及合内外逆顺。 命机之法，共八篇，论太阴太阳真气，逐日下时，聚散去住，贯串分内外应用，丹药功运，次第造化。 天机之法共五篇，论合文立坛，象分刻漏，定日月交合去住，弦望晦朔，四季变易。 五日一候，四十五日一节，九十日一时，内外相会行持，通计一十八篇。 初机法三乘之道，即有三乘九品，出身并各不同。 上有上道三品，行抱一守中，莫非龙汞虎铅之金丹也。 中有中道三品，行神水华池，莫非虎铅龙汞之大药也。 下有下道三品，行运精采气，莫非乾汞坤铅之大功也。 已上九品立身之肇基，皆自铅汞而成。 铅汞者，天地万物之宗祖也。 又汞者，本出於木，是木之精。 又铅者，自白金而有，是金之气，木即是龙，金即是虎。 古仙歌曰：若识金精，得之长生，金精是铅，汞会成丹。 铅汞相投，神仙可求，铅汞相凝，道无不成。 若遇真铅，可以身延。 又云：下士若达真铅汞，历尽春秋万万年。 故非铅汞，不能立之。 铅汞者，是真阴真阳也，方是真道。 乾汞坤铅下乘三品出身大功章 乾汞者，父之精，坤铅者，母之气。 二气暗合，阴阳交会机宜，夺造化成人。 又父者，木也； 精者，火也； 母者，金也； 气者，水也。 金木水火，谓之四象，土制之，共聚为宝。 其数满二十四气，随荣卫运转周身，日用九十六度，其数又满三百八十四，阴阳气足，准此三十日气圆，三百日形体俱备，降世为人。 人能返用生身二气，施摄於身，夺天地造化，受阴阳气数满足，变凡入圣，故曰乾汞坤铅之大功。 大功者，盖人因乾汞坤铅之二气，合而成形，今却投造化修炼乾汞坤铅，气满，谓之神符。 神符气备，谓之白雪，白雪气备，反变乾汞坤铅，入於至道，故曰大功。 人若自生身无破犯元神，神与气全，达大功之机，修炼功圆，是为下乘上品，住世号曰神仙。 若中年已破犯，可半得大功之机，修炼功圆，是为喝下乘中品，住世 号曰地仙。 若老年之极，其神气破犯三分之二，而得大功初机，修炼功圆，是为下乘下品，得满於常寿，脱壳得为地仙。 此是下乘三品之位也。 虎铅龙汞中乘三品大药气章 虎铅者，白虎之真气也； 白虎者，金也，金者，阴也，阴者真阴也。 又铅者，白虎中真气所聚之物，故曰虎铅。 龙汞者，青龙之真精也； 青龙者，木也，木者，阳也，阳者，真阳也。 又汞者，青龙中精真气所成之物，故 曰龙汞也。 龙汞与虎铅相合，得土恩育，三百日造化为黄芽，黄芽气既备变凡为圣，故曰大药。 且如龙与汞，龙属木，汞属火，火之气数满三，木之气数满九，三与九共十二也。 虎与铅者，虎属金，铅属水，金之气数满七，水之气数满五，五与七共十二，四象之气共二十四，以应一月之用。 又龙位居卯，而虎位居酉，卯酉之位，金七气，木九气，合数得十六，应一斤之用。 卯即是木，木即是阳也，酉即是金，金即是阴也。 阴中有三阳神，神气精； 阳中有三阴神，神气精。 三阳三阴，共得六神，外象即六爻配金木二气，为八节八卦也。 每卦又复出八卦，共八八六十四数卦。 次复准此，相生相合，而生三百八十四，爻主身之神。

**The Three Mechanisms**

**The Initial Mechanism**
The method of the Initial Mechanism comprises five sections, discussing yin-yang, the Three Origins, Four Images, Five Phases’ generative and fulfilled numbers, qi numerology and qi signs, divided into three grades, and the convergence of internal and external, reverse and顺.

**The Mechanism of Destiny**
The method of the Mechanism of Destiny comprises eight sections, expounding on the true qi of Greater Yin and Greater Yang, its daily descent and hourly movements, gathering and dispersion, going and abiding, interpenetration and internal-external application, the circulation of elixir and medicinal efficacy, and the sequential transformations of creation.

**The Celestial Mechanism**
The method of the Celestial Mechanism comprises five sections, discussing the establishment of altars in accordance with texts, the division of symbolic time by clepsydra, the determination of the conjunctions and separations of the sun and moon, the waxing and waning crescents, new and full moons, and the transitions of the four seasons. Five days make one qi sign, forty-five days one seasonal node, ninety days one seasonal period, with internal and external practices converging in cultivation. In total, these comprise eighteen sections.

The method of the Initial Mechanism pertains to the Three Vehicles’ Dao, which encompasses three vehicles and nine grades, each with distinct paths of emergence.

**The Upper Vehicle’s Three Grades**
Practicing the embrace of the One and preservation of the center—none other than the golden elixir of Dragon Mercury and Tiger Lead.

**The Middle Vehicle’s Three Grades**
Practicing the divine water of the Flower Pool—none other than the great medicine of Tiger Lead and Dragon Mercury.

**The Lower Vehicle’s Three Grades**
Practicing the circulation of essence, absorption of qi—none other than the great achievement of Qian Mercury and Kun Lead.

The nine grades above establish the foundation of embodied existence, all formed from Lead and Mercury. Lead and Mercury are the ancestral origin of heaven, earth, and the myriad things.

Moreover, Mercury originates from Wood, being Wood’s essence. Lead arises from White Metal, being Metal’s qi. Wood is the Dragon; Metal is the Tiger. An ancient immortal song says:
*If one recognizes Metal’s essence, one attains longevity.
Metal’s essence is Lead; with Mercury, the elixir is formed.
When Lead and Mercury unite, immortality may be sought.
When Lead and Mercury congeal, the Dao is without fail.*
*Should one encounter true Lead, one may extend one’s years.*
It is also said:
*If a lesser adept grasps true Lead and Mercury,
they shall traverse myriad springs and autumns.*
Thus, without Lead and Mercury, nothing can be established. Lead and Mercury are true Yin and true Yang—only then is it the true Dao.

**Chapter on the Great Achievement of the Lower Vehicle’s Three Grades: Qian Mercury and Kun Lead**
Qian Mercury is the father’s essence; Kun Lead is the mother’s qi. The two qi subtly converge, the mechanism of yin-yang union seizing creation to form a human.

Moreover, the father is Wood; essence is Fire. The mother is Metal; qi is Water. Metal, Wood, Water, and Fire are the Four Images, governed by Earth, converging as treasure. Their number fills twenty-four qi, circulating with the constructive and protective qi throughout the body, completing ninety-six cycles daily. Their number further fills three hundred eighty-four, and when yin and yang qi are sufficient, this accords with thirty days of qi completion and three hundred days of bodily formation, descending into the world as a human.

If one can reverse and employ the two qi that gave birth to the body, applying them to oneself, seizing heaven and earth’s creation, receiving the fullness of yin-yang qi numerology, one transforms from the ordinary to the sagely—hence the great achievement of Qian Mercury and Kun Lead.

The great achievement lies in this: humans are formed by the union of Qian Mercury and Kun Lead’s two qi; now, by refining Qian Mercury and Kun Lead in accordance with creation, when qi is full, it is called the *Divine Talisman*. When the Divine Talisman’s qi is complete, it is called *White Snow*. When White Snow’s qi is complete, it reverts to Qian Mercury and Kun Lead, entering the supreme Dao—hence the great achievement.

If, from birth, one’s original spirit remains unviolated, spirit and qi intact, grasping the mechanism of great achievement and completing cultivation, this is the upper grade of the Lower Vehicle, dwelling in the world as an immortal. If one has violated it in middle age, one may attain half the mechanism of great achievement; completing cultivation, this is the middle grade of the Lower Vehicle, dwelling in the world as an Earthly Immortal. If, in extreme old age, two-thirds of one’s spirit and qi are violated, yet one attains the initial mechanism of great achievement and completes cultivation, this is the lower grade of the Lower Vehicle, attaining the fullness of ordinary longevity and shedding the mortal coil to become an Earthly Immortal. These are the three grades of the Lower Vehicle.

**Chapter on the Great Medicine of the Middle Vehicle’s Three Grades: Tiger Lead and Dragon Mercury**
Tiger Lead is the true qi of the White Tiger. The White Tiger is Metal; Metal is Yin; Yin is true Yin. Moreover, Lead is the substance in which the White Tiger’s true qi gathers—hence Tiger Lead.

Dragon Mercury is the true essence of the Azure Dragon. The Azure Dragon is Wood; Wood is Yang; Yang is true Yang. Moreover, Mercury is the substance formed by the Azure Dragon’s true essence and qi—hence Dragon Mercury.

When Dragon Mercury and Tiger Lead unite, receiving Earth’s nurturance, three hundred days of creation yield the Yellow Sprout. Once the Yellow Sprout’s qi is complete, one transforms from the ordinary to the sagely—hence the great medicine.

For example, the Dragon and Mercury: the Dragon pertains to Wood, Mercury to Fire. Fire’s qi number fills three; Wood’s qi number fills nine—three and nine together make twelve. **Chapter on the Three Grades of the Upper Vehicle’s Dragon Lead and Tiger Mercury**

It takes the true lead of the White Tiger and returns it to the original palace of the Azure Dragon, where Yin and Yang intersect. Tiger Mercury: The Tiger inherently has no mercury; it is born from the Dragon. First, the true lead of the White Tiger is taken to subdue the true mercury of the Azure Dragon. When the Four Symbols complete twenty-four *qi*, with a numerical value of five, and the five breaths summon the Four Symbols, all enter the Central Palace, receiving the *qi* of the Five Phases—this is called "one cycle of the heavens." Whenever circulating the *qi* of the Four Symbols, one must follow the method of *qi*-circulation: first close all six gates, wait until the limit of endurance is reached, then exert force to swallow, dividing each swallow into three gulps, guiding the *qi* directly to the Primordial Palace, where the divine tortoise inhales through the left nostril. This is called "directing *qi*," also known as "circulating fire," or "activating the constructive and defensive *qi*."

Whenever one wishes to circulate *qi*, one must first circulate fire. For example, when beginning, the lungs first circulate fire once, allowing the lung *qi* to penetrate all joints and limbs without exception. After the lungs complete seven cycles, fire is circulated once more to connect with the kidney’s *qi*. After the kidneys complete five cycles, fire is circulated again to connect with the liver’s *qi*. After the liver completes nine cycles, fire is circulated once more to connect with the heart’s *qi*. After the heart completes three cycles, fire is circulated five times in accordance with the method, and the Four Symbols all receive the great harmony of the Central Palace, thus fulfilling the generative and transformative numbers of the Four Symbols and Five Phases—this is called "a cycle of the heavens." Each hexagram divides into six line-spirits, totaling three hundred eighty-four line-spirits, which supplement the fullness of yin and yang *qi*. Externally, they generate three hundred eighty-four line-spirits; internally, they generate three hundred eighty-four masters of the body. Essence, light, and spirit mutually generate one another; externally, they complete the myriad phenomena of the cosmos—twelve thousand spirits of form and shadow, twelve thousand spirits of ingress and egress, twelve thousand spirits of true *qi*; internally, they complete thirty-six thousand spirits. For those who attain this profound mechanism, let them focus their minds in stillness, wholly concentrate their spirits, and practice in accordance with the proper timing. Though they may not attain immortality, they can prolong their lives beyond the common span. Once this span is fulfilled and the *qi* can no longer advance, they will naturally expire—becoming earthbound immortals who shed their mortal forms. This is because, at the time of cultivation, there was no primordial *qi*; the method of nurturing life and preserving destiny lies only in gathering essence and perfecting the spirit.

Consider how, when a person initially receives the two *qi* to form a body, the *qi* within the body has its own limits. With no place for the master to reside, in all cultivation, one must first cultivate the body and replenish the *qi*. Only when the body and *qi* are fully restored can one nurture destiny—nothing will be unattainable. Old yin seizes young yang, and the yin life naturally flourishes;
Old intestines seize young yin, and the yang lifespan remains unharmed by death.
Those who comprehend this method can rescue the old to become young, reversing aging to return to youth. Once the old attain youth, what other path is there? Simply cultivate according to the root—naturally reversing old age to return to youth. The root is true *qi*; if true *qi* is preserved, it transforms into immortality. If true *qi* is diminished but restored, it becomes the foundation of humanity. Only one *qi* serves as the seed, responding to the creation and transformation of yin and yang, again becoming the root—thus the seed is inexhaustible.

If one’s original true *qi* remains unviolated, grasping the creation and transformation of heaven and earth and practicing accordingly, one can become an immortal. If it has been damaged, relying on the present spirit and *qi* to practice can extend life beyond the common span, becoming an earthbound immortal. If one can apply true *qi* to the body, following the waxing moon’s conjunction to act, receiving the fullness of the transformative *qi* of creation, one will naturally attain spiritual communion.

For those whose true *qi* is severely depleted, take sixteen ounces of black lead of utmost sincerity. Once the lead is obtained, use a bell as a furnace. The lead bell is the white metal of the West’s proper *qi*. For the finest furnaces, use five pounds; for lesser ones, forty-five pounds; for medium ones, ninety pounds; and for the top, five pounds. chunks.original_text: 且人虽曾犯破，已又不可犯之俱尽，犯之既尽，人即自死。 人既未死，盖有见在神气为主，但将见在神气，修令坚固，候满常寿，脱壳为地仙。 若又能补益而修者，定证神仙也。 入虎铅龙汞理矣！ 真五行定命气章 夫人立命，须认五行，解定金锁，养就玄珠，存神於元宫，伏气於肾内，回精上朝於太和，此入圣之门也。 五行者，真五行也，非束西南北中、金木水火土五行也。 此五行者，盖是配象，有名无形，五行真象，名具形体，又非人之五藏。 人之五藏，亦是真五行结就也。 惟土无正形，生成造化，皆因土也。 外生天地，内备人身。 真金者，人之母也； 真木者，人之父也； 真水者，金之气也； 真火者，木之精也； 真土者，母之元宫也。 四象生黑，聚入元宫得土制之，造化成人。 人身四象气聚，五行造化，无一物不成形质。 既要修行，但只依根本造化，神仙自然而出，故须认得五行，定却金锁。 金锁者，谓得真铅，伏住真汞，共聚为宝。 金铅结伏其汞，故曰玄珠。 金锁二气结伏，造化为珠，存神为元，宫谓四象真气生就万神，致於元宫也。 存养伏气於肾内者，谓玄珠备二十四气，复生三百八十 四气，将此气伏於肾内，谓之伏气。 回精上朝者，令身内神气，随荣卫运转，往来造化为回精之道，又日金精。 二气相合法兼结气功章 夫二气者，虎铅龙汞也，虎铅者，聚即元宫为宝，散即周身为气，气来即聚，气聚即合，气散即运，故不得有差失。 结气者，二气相见，其气方结，假令朔后一日癸时，太阴气来，依时取铅，真气降，铅亦降，取归青龙元宫，岂独一气而得备乎！ 故得二气，方能备也。 又虎铅者，是白金之真气，取白金一十四两已下，十三两已上，於静室内香水浴过，用药昏却本性，候时至而取之如常，不令外气所犯。 如犯外气者，不入元宫，随滓而出。 如依时取得真铅，便令二气相合结之，若是癸时取得，丑时便合。 如取得，复令金木相会克，受金之所克，其情必动，情既动则真气降，真气降，欲则泄，制令勿泄，则二气自然相合也，次后日时准此。 又结气者，为真铅结住真汞，谓四象五行备也，是人立身之根本也。 且人身之立，三十日气备，三百日造化方得成形。 此立身之处，本位元住白虎元宫，坤家所住。 坤者，真土也，四象真气，得土为主，故不能毁坏，尚自毁损不一，可况令反取二气，致青龙元宫。 此住处，其气无类，故别有三十日恩养法，三百日造化机，若达此机，得天地造化，何虑此身不作神仙也！ 三十日恩养者，二气相合，结气之后，不得更有作用，及诸思虑，专遣同道二人，则候时刻，内外相合，得四象气足，入至中宫，满阴阳正数极，致三十日，自然凝结。 如行气候不满，及数不足，气难得备，故须专志恩养三十日，以后三百日，亦足天地造化，合内外行动，无不达也。 五行各现本色与内外相应章 凡行五藏气者，看逐季月日，与内外相应合行持。 且如肝藏属木旺春，三月内选甲乙日时，端坐正身，绝虑忘思，密闭地户，大启天门，出入绵绵，不令奔逸。 一心使荣卫运转肝藏气，自夹脊双关，上通致脑，自顶门而下，降入口中，咽漱归十二重楼，先传於肺，肺传於肾，肾传於肝，肝传於心，心传於脾，脾传入於元宫，神龟所受。

Moreover, though one may have previously suffered depletion, one must not deplete it entirely—once depleted to the utmost, the person will surely die. Since the person has not yet died, it is because the present *shen* and *qi* still govern. By cultivating and fortifying these present *shen* and *qi*, awaiting the fulfillment of one’s natural lifespan, one may shed the mortal husk to become an earthbound immortal. If one can further supplement and refine them, one will surely attain the rank of divine immortal. Herein lies the principle of tiger-lead and dragon-mercury!

**The True Five Phases Determine the Qi of Destiny**

For one to establish destiny, one must recognize the Five Phases, resolve the golden lock, and nurture the mysterious pearl. Store the *shen* within the primordial palace and subdue the *qi* within the kidneys, returning the essence to ascend and pay homage to the Great Harmony—this is the gateway to sagehood.

The Five Phases are the *true* Five Phases, not the east, west, south, north, and center, nor the wood, fire, earth, metal, and water of ordinary reckoning. These Five Phases are but symbolic correspondences, possessing names yet no form. The true images of the Five Phases have names and forms, yet they are not the five viscera of the human body. The five viscera of the human body are also constituted by the true Five Phases. Only earth has no fixed form; all generation and transformation arise from earth. Externally, it gives birth to heaven and earth; internally, it completes the human body.

True metal is the mother of the human; true wood is the father; true water is the *qi* of metal; true fire is the essence of wood; true earth is the primordial palace of the mother. The four images generate the mysterious, and when gathered into the primordial palace, earth governs them, bringing forth the transformation that becomes the human. The four images of the human body gather *qi*, and the Five Phases enact transformation—nothing fails to take form.

If one seeks to cultivate the Dao, one need only follow the root of transformation, and the divine immortal will naturally emerge. Thus, one must recognize the Five Phases and resolve the golden lock. The golden lock refers to obtaining true lead to subdue true mercury, uniting them as a treasure. When lead binds and subdues mercury, it is called the mysterious pearl. The union of the two *qi* of the golden lock generates transformation into the pearl; storing the *shen* within the primordial palace means that the true *qi* of the four images gives birth to the myriad spirits, converging in the primordial palace.

To "store and subdue the *qi* within the kidneys" means that the mysterious pearl, possessing the twenty-four *qi*, further generates three hundred and eighty-four *qi*. Directing this *qi* to be subdued within the kidneys is called "subduing the *qi*." "Returning the essence to ascend and pay homage" means that the *shen* and *qi* within the body follow the circulation of *ying* and *wei*, moving and transforming to become the path of returning essence—also called golden essence.

**The Two Qi Unite and the Method of Binding Qi**

The two *qi* are tiger-lead and dragon-mercury. Tiger-lead, when gathered, becomes a treasure in the primordial palace; when dispersed, it circulates as *qi* throughout the body. When *qi* arrives, it gathers; when gathered, it unites; when dispersed, it moves—thus, there must be no error. Binding *qi* occurs when the two *qi* meet and unite. For instance, on the first day after the new moon at the *gui* hour, the *qi* of the Great Yin arrives. At the proper time, one draws the lead; when true *qi* descends, lead also descends. Taking it into the primordial palace of the Azure Dragon, how could one be content with a single *qi*? Only with both *qi* can one be complete.

Moreover, tiger-lead is the true *qi* of white metal. Take between thirteen and fourteen ounces of white metal, bathe it in fragrant water within a quiet chamber, and use medicine to subdue its original nature. Await the proper time to draw it as usual, preventing contamination by external *qi*. If external *qi* intrudes, it will not enter the primordial palace but will be expelled with the dregs. If true lead is obtained at the proper time, immediately unite the two *qi* to bind them. If obtained at the *gui* hour, unite them at the *chou* hour. Once obtained, allow metal and wood to meet and overcome each other. When metal is overcome, its nature is stirred; once stirred, true *qi* descends. When true *qi* descends, desire arises and threatens to leak. By restraining it from leaking, the two *qi* naturally unite. Subsequent days and hours follow this pattern.

Furthermore, binding *qi* means that true lead binds true mercury, signifying that the four images and Five Phases are complete—this is the root of human existence. The establishment of the human body requires thirty days for *qi* to be complete and three hundred days for transformation to achieve form. This place of establishment is the original dwelling of the White Tiger in the primordial palace, the abode of *kun*. *Kun* is true earth; the true *qi* of the four images take earth as their master, and thus they cannot be destroyed. Even so, they may still suffer varying degrees of harm—how much more so when one reverses the process to draw the two *qi* into the primordial palace of the Azure Dragon? This dwelling place is without peer in its *qi*, and thus there is a thirty-day method of nurturing and a three-hundred-day mechanism of transformation. If one grasps this mechanism and attains the transformation of heaven and earth, how could one not become a divine immortal?

The thirty-day nurturing involves, after the two *qi* unite and bind, refraining from further activity or distracting thoughts. Assign two fellow cultivators to observe the timing, harmonizing inner and outer to ensure the four images’ *qi* is sufficient. When it enters the central palace and fulfills the proper count of yin and yang, after thirty days, it will naturally congeal. If the circulation of *qi* is incomplete or the count insufficient, the *qi* will not be complete. Thus, one must single-mindedly nurture it for thirty days. Thereafter, the three hundred days will also fulfill the transformation of heaven and earth, aligning inner and outer movements without obstruction.

**The Five Phases Manifest Their True Colors and Correspond Within and Without**

When circulating the *qi* of the five viscera, observe the seasons, months, and days to align inner and outer correspondences in practice. For instance, the liver viscus belongs to wood and flourishes in spring. Within the three months of spring, select an *jia* or *yi* day and hour. Sit upright, free from thoughts and distractions, tightly seal the earthly gate, and fully open the heavenly gate. Inhale and exhale softly, preventing the *qi* from rushing or scattering. With single-minded focus, cause the *ying* and *wei* to circulate the *qi* of the liver viscus. It ascends from the double passes of the spine to reach the brain, then descends from the crown of the head into the mouth. After rinsing and swallowing, it enters the twelve-storied tower, first transmitting to the lungs, then to the kidneys, kidneys to the liver, liver to the heart, heart to the spleen, and spleen into the primordial palace, where the spirit-turtle receives it.

The Azure Dragon’s true *qi* is true mercury, and true mercury is the Azure Dragon’s abode of utmost essence.

Therefore, one employs subtle means to secretly draw the White Tiger’s true lead into the Azure Dragon’s primordial palace.

All lead originally resides within the White Tiger’s primordial palace, yet when returned to the Azure Dragon’s primordial palace, it remains untainted and thus abides there. **Chapter on Generating the Mysterious Pearl**

The method of the Mysterious Pearl requires fourteen taels of unrefined white gold, up to one catty. Once obtained, cause Metal and Wood to meet, with the mind undisturbed, free from extraneous intent. Employ the numbers of yin and yang as its guiding principle; when the nine-nines are complete, it is achieved.

If Wood senses decline, use Metal to restrain it, preventing movement. Then close the eyes, arch the spine, contract the abdomen, and gather the qi. Curl the ten fingers like hooks, drawing up the primordial qi without the slightest wavering. After a long while in concentrated stillness, wait until settled, then repeat the process. Again, follow the previous method to restrain the Azure Dragon’s true qi from leaking, returning it to the primordial palace. Proceed thus, performing sixteen cycles at the proper times, and it will coalesce into the Mysterious Pearl.

The Mysterious Pearl is formed by the convergence of the true qi of the Four Symbols. The Four Symbols arise from Metal and Wood! Wood is the Azure Dragon, the Dragon is yang; Metal is the White Tiger, the Tiger is yin. Within yin lies true essence—lead; within yang lies true essence—mercury. Lead restrains mercury, and mercury clings to lead. When lead and mercury unite, they naturally resonate, and the Mysterious Pearl is effortlessly achieved.

Thus, first employ subtle means to draw true lead back to reside in the Azure Dragon’s primordial palace, whereupon mercury will naturally remain as well. Lead and mercury are the abodes of the Dragon and Tiger’s purest essences. When the qi of Dragon and Tiger obtain lead and mercury, they naturally converge, forming a resonant bond called the Mysterious Pearl.

How is this known? Initially, true lead is congealed within the Azure Dragon’s primordial palace. Later, Metal and Wood are again made to meet. Wood, subdued by Metal, stirs in its nature—once stirred, its qi descends, and with descent comes the urge to leak. Restrain it to prevent leakage, yet it cannot return to its origin, nor can it ascend. Thus, it reverts to its root-source, re-entering the palace to unite with mercury, coalescing into the Mysterious Pearl. This is accomplished below the navel, where intense heat arises, like a cauldron ablaze.

**Chapter on the Mysterious Pearl Coalescing into the Golden Elixir**

Again, cause Metal and Wood to meet, proceeding with meticulous care. When the Metal Tiger’s nature is stirred to its utmost, and the intent cannot be restrained—when it rushes urgently toward Wood—then release the Mysterious Pearl to enter the Palace of Mutual Resonance.

This palace belongs to Earth, encompassing the Five Phases. When thirty days’ qi is complete, the form and image are fully realized, seizing the three hundred days of Heaven and Earth’s transformation. With upper and lower harmonized, perfection is attained—this is called the Golden Elixir.

After ten months of fulfillment, it descends from beneath the left breast, the size of a cherry, its body like fresh blood, radiant with crimson-purple light that dazzles the eye—this is the Golden Elixir. When the White Tiger receives the Mysterious Pearl at the Cavity of Mutual Resonance, this qi differs from ordinary times. Greatly avoid sorrow and joy, cold and heat, anger and hunger, strife and satiety. If any of these are violated, the elixir will surely be ruined.

Thus, one must daily maintain tranquility, preventing disturbance, and focus solely on the elixir’s qi reaching completion. When it is about to descend, use a vessel of contention to receive it, bathe it in fragrant water, and once its qi is fully stabilized and cooled, place it upon the altar in the heart. Carry the elixir upward from the Earth Gate, ascending to the Three Markets of the Altar. Stand facing north, raise your gaze, and give thanks to the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Dao Lord, and the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy. Then swallow it, forever anchoring it within the primordial palace.

Thus it is said: Store the spirit and retain the qi, returning essence upward to the brain, allowing upper and lower qi to communicate. The elixir’s qi circulates, naturally effecting transformation—silently transmuting sinews, bones, skin, and hair—entering the sagely Dao.

For the Golden Elixir can transform the dharma-realm’s heaven and earth, transcending the mundane to attain sagehood, enabling the communication of upper and lower qi and the opening of all joints. As the Golden Elixir’s qi circulates, it silently transmutes the mortal body into an immortal form. Those who ingest it will, within three years, completely transform their mortal frame, becoming a Perfected One. They will ascend freely, paying homage to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy—this is no falsehood!

Thus, thirty-six thousand spirits of luminous essence, twelve thousand spirits of form and shadow, twelve thousand spirits of true qi, and twelve thousand spirits of ingress and egress attend and guard, moving freely in all directions. This arises from the yin and yang qi. The two qi govern the Four Symbols, the Four Symbols establish the Five Phases, the Five Phases generate the myriad things, and the myriad things are the myriad spirits.

**Chapter on the Establishment of the Great Dao through Golden Liquor and White Paste**

Golden Liquor and White Paste are transformations of the true qi of the Four Symbols. The Four Symbols arise from the union of Dragon and Tiger, the congealing of lead and mercury, which are then matched within the Central Palace, encompassing the Five Phases.

The Dragon and Tiger are true yin and true yang. Within yang are the three yin: spirit, qi, and essence; within yin are the three yang: spirit, qi, and essence—these are Kan, Gen, Zhen, Xun, Li, and Dui. Three within yin and three within yang make six, paired with Dragon and Tiger to form eight. Each eight generates another eight, yielding sixty-four hexagrams, each with six lines, totaling three hundred eighty-four lines. Within the body, three hundred eighty-four spirits arise. Each yin spirit and yang spirit unite, generating another three hundred eighty-four spirits, thus producing thirty-six thousand spirits throughout the body. This arises from yin and yang generating the Four Symbols, the Four Symbols generating the Five Phases, and the Five Phases generating the myriad things.

When the human body first receives the two qi in the mother’s womb, after thirty days the qi is complete. Beneath the breasts, a membrane forms, from which flows the Golden Liquor—this is the Golden Liquor and White Paste. Once this paste is obtained and irrigates the body, it naturally seizes the transformations of Heaven and Earth, thereby forming the human body.

If one seeks to cultivate the body, how can one depart from the Golden Liquor and White Paste? When a person first receives the two qi in the mother’s primordial palace, they descend beneath the breasts to generate the Golden Liquor and White Paste. Now, if one returns to receive the two qi within one’s own primordial palace, from whence shall the Golden Liquor and White Paste emerge?

**Chapter on the Method of Departure and Abiding During the Conjunction of Sun and Moon**

Those who cultivate and refine must observe the movements of the sun and moon—what does this mean? Heaven and Earth employ the sun and moon as their function, while humans employ the constructive and protective qi as theirs. If learners align their internal sun and moon with the external sun and moon, moving in perfect accord, their lifespan will equal that of Heaven and Earth.

Now, Heaven and Earth exchange the qi of the twelve pitch-pipes and Five Phases, while the sun and moon conjoin to produce and nurture the myriad things. If the sun and moon conjoin but their qi do not, it harms the fields of the body. If the sun and moon move but their qi do not, one gradually declines into aging and illness. Simply emulate the movements of the sun and moon with the constructive and protective qi, governing them within the body—then there is no way for aging to take hold, and one naturally attains longevity and eternal life.

That Heaven endures and Earth abides is due to the governance of the Three Wonders: the sun, moon, and stars. The sun, moon, and stars are the purest essences of Heaven and Earth, called the Three Wonders. If there were no sun by day or moon by night, where would the stars remain in Heaven and Earth? The Three Wonders of humans are spirit, qi, and essence. If one’s spirit departs, essence is exhausted, and qi is cut off, where would the person remain?

Spirit is the qi of the constructive and protective forces: the constructive is the sun, the protective is the moon. When the external sun and moon meet, internally cause the qi to unite; when the external sun and moon move, internally cause the qi to flow. Thus, one’s lifespan naturally equals that of Heaven and Earth, and aging no longer occurs. If one further refines the elixir, there is nothing that does not reach the state of Heaven and Earth.

Moreover, the movements of the sun and moon follow a thirty-day cycle, each with its own method. The sun has twelve hours in a day, but only nine are responsive—three are unresponsive. Over thirty days, this amounts to 360 hours, of which 270 are responsive and ninety are not. The moon, in thirty days, shines for only twenty-four; the six days before and after remain unseen. This is because the moon is born in *shen* and its qi moves in reverse, reaching the *xu*, *hai*, and *zi* palaces—pure yin’s abode and the moon’s secret chamber. Within thirty days, the first three and last three days find the moon returning to its original palace, not leaving its own abode—the *xu*, *hai*, and *zi* palaces. Arriving at its own palace, it abides, hence it does not shine.

The sun is born in *yin* and moves forward to the *xu*, *hai*, and *zi* palaces, where it encounters the moon’s position. There, the two qi meet and conjoin, so it does not respond. From the twenty-seventh to the third day of the next cycle—six days in total—is the time of the sun and moon’s pregnancy. Thus, the moon does not shine, and the sun does not respond. Arriving at its own palace, it abides, hence it does not shine.

If learners have obtained sufficient qi, they should align the internal with the external. When the sun and moon conjoin, the constructive and protective qi should also conjoin; when the sun and moon move, the constructive and protective qi should also flow—this is the union of internal and external. The first three and last three days, the moon parts from the sun at *chen* hour, returning to its original palace. From the fourth to the eighth day and the twenty-third to the twenty-seventh day, the sun parts from the moon at *chou* hour. The moon first emerges above *geng* on the third day and gradually sets after the twenty-seventh. From the eighth to the twenty-third day, the sun parts from the moon at *gui* hour, and the moon’s qi is full, hence it shines brightly in the world. The qi and seasons of the sun and moon move in unison with those of Heaven and Earth, not differing by even a fraction—thus Heaven and Earth endure. If learners follow this method, causing the constructive and protective qi to unite with the sun and moon and circulate within the body, their qi and seasons will not err, and their lifespan will equal that of Heaven, Earth, sun, and moon. These are the methods governing the sun, moon, constructive, and protective qi within the thirty-day cycle.

**Chapter on the Conjunction of Sun, Moon, and Qi of the Three Origins for Establishing Life**

Each time this practice is performed, proceed as follows:
- From the first to the third day after the new moon, begin at *gui* hour and cease at *xu* hour;
- From the fourth to the eighth day, begin at *chou* hour and cease at *xu* hour;
- From the ninth to the twenty-third day, begin at *gen* hour and cease at *xu* hour;

chunks.original_text: 便闭气候，力极不任，咽送至元官，一日行火，二日通气，三要助於荣卫。 行满一十六周天，为一功，一日十二时，九时行功，三时住功，满一十六转，得阴阳气备。 至三十日内，其气凝实，三百日造化自全，但依此功，自然准的。 夫太阴真气者，白虎真铅也，是万物之母，遇太阳真气降亦降，太阴真气伏亦伏，即降为杳冥杳冥之内，太阴真气所住也。 太阴气降，有时有日，若日时不合而用者，万万中无一得道也。 盖 缘太阴真气伏降，何须苦意强求，但令依其气降，日时大事，无不成也。 每朔前二十八日至朔后初三日，此六日是太阴交合日，故太阳真气降，来往六日，各逐日下功有时。 朔后一日与三十日，癸时真气来至，丑时聚，艮时散。 初二日与二十九日，子时真气来，癸时聚，丑时散。 初三日与二十八日，壬时来，子时聚，癸时散。 凡取真铅，须候气来即取，气聚则合，气散则运，若差毫厘，即功无益。 只如人运丹与见在神气，并须气来即取，气聚即合，气散即运，来而不取，气滞； 聚而不合，气谢； 散而不运，气堪。 此暗败之形体也。 若不见此机，空有万种行持，皆取死之辈也。 起功定立坛象气章 夫立坛理者，正天地之气候也，候作天地之初机者，日月五星也。 日月者，太阴太阳也，五星者，五行也，若日月五星运转，天地气候不差，则四时自然成规矩也。 人之枢机者，荣卫五藏也，若得荣卫五藏合度，即四时无不应候。 日月五行分行七气，荣卫五藏亦行七气也，则循环三百六十日，合得一周天之数。 立五日一候，四十五日一节，九十日一气。 五日一候者，为六十甲子神行事，每1 日分十二辰，故立十二时者，得六十时，六甲神气周遍数足，乃从五甲子神复用，故曰五日一候，三百六十日共得七十二候。 人若得气候不差，亦然也。 四十五日一节者，谓一日有十二时，六时阴，六时阳，配昼夜为节，即为八卦，此八卦是一日之用神也，人亦有十二位元神，名六阴神、六阳神，配合荣卫为八卦，亦是一日之用神也。 四十五日； 合得三百六十时正数，故谓之一节，三百六十时共六得八节。 九十日为一气者，谓四十五日得三百六十神之气，用九十日，共得七百二十，故谓之一气。 三百六十日共有四气，人亦然也。 若能用荣卫五藏运转，周身往来无滞，合天地运动於身，自然分五日一候，四十五日为节，九十日为一气，与天之气不差分杪，无不达也。 盖为不知天地之气候行动，运转身田真气，曾犯破元神，神气不足，故与外气不能相合。 人若无犯破者，神与气全，只投此机，用依日月气候交合，定刻漏不差，无不达也。 若人曾犯破元神者，捉得根本来处而修，卸补令气备神全精足，依法而修，无不达也。 定十二时分刻漏四象真气聚散章 夫天地运转者，以刻漏为准，起功定位，分刻漏之纲者，一日分定百刻。 百刻者，於十二时上，分配子午卯酉四位，各分九刻，寅申一巳亥辰戌丑未八位，各分八刻，四九三十六，八八六十四，共计一百刻，定昼夜气候。 从子为一阳起首，是阳气生之始也，午后为一阴，是阴气长之初也。 至卯为盛阳之至也，子者位应北方壬癸水，卦主坎，其象玄武，水神也。

The true qi of Greater Yin is the White Tiger’s true lead, the mother of all things. When the true qi of Greater Yang descends, it descends; when the true qi of Greater Yin lies concealed, it lies concealed. When descending, it enters the profound obscurity where the true qi of Greater Yin resides. The descent of Greater Yin qi occurs at specific times and days; if one practices when the day and hour do not align, not one in ten thousand will attain the Dao. Since the true qi of Greater Yin descends and conceals of its own accord, there is no need for forced effort—simply follow its descent, and all great matters of timing will be accomplished.

From the twenty-eighth day before the new moon to the third day after, these six days are the days of Greater Yin’s conjunction. Thus, the true qi of Greater Yang descends, and for these six days, practice must be conducted according to the designated hours. On the day after the new moon and the thirtieth day, the true qi arrives at the *gui* hour, gathers at the *chou* hour, and disperses at the *gen* hour. On the second day and the twenty-ninth day, the true qi arrives at the *zi* hour, gathers at the *gui* hour, and disperses at the *chou* hour. On the third day and the twenty-eighth day, it arrives at the *ren* hour, gathers at the *zi* hour, and disperses at the *gui* hour.

When gathering true lead, one must await the arrival of the qi to take it; when the qi gathers, unite with it; when it disperses, circulate it. If even a hair’s breadth is misaligned, the practice will be of no benefit. Just as in refining the elixir or perceiving the present spirit and qi, one must take the qi when it arrives, unite with it when it gathers, and circulate it when it disperses. To fail to take it when it arrives is to stagnate the qi; to fail to unite when it gathers is to exhaust the qi; to fail to circulate when it disperses is to waste the qi. These are the subtle signs of decay in the body. Without perceiving this mechanism, even with ten thousand kinds of practice, one will only join the ranks of those who court death.

**Establishing the Altar and Configuring the Qi Manifestation**

To establish the altar is to align with the qi cycles of Heaven and Earth. To await the initial movement of Heaven and Earth is to observe the sun, moon, and five planets. The sun and moon are Greater Yin and Greater Yang; the five planets are the Five Phases. When the sun, moon, and five planets revolve, the qi cycles of Heaven and Earth do not err, and the four seasons naturally follow their proper order.

The pivot of the human body is the constructive, protective, and five viscera qi. If the constructive, protective, and five viscera qi are harmonized, the four seasons will naturally respond. The sun, moon, and five planets divide and circulate the seven qi, and the constructive, protective, and five viscera qi likewise circulate the seven qi, completing a cycle of three hundred and sixty days, which corresponds to one celestial revolution.

Five days constitute one *hou* (climatic phase), forty-five days one *jie* (seasonal node), and ninety days one *qi* (seasonal qi). The five-day *hou* is established because the sixty *jiazi* spirits govern affairs, and each day is divided into twelve *chen* (double-hours), thus twelve hours form one day. The qi of the six *jia* spirits completes a full cycle, then returns to the five *jiazi* spirits, hence "five days make one *hou*." In three hundred and sixty days, there are seventy-two *hou*. If one’s qi cycles do not err, the same applies.

Forty-five days make one *jie* because a day has twelve hours—six yin and six yang—paired with day and night to form a node, corresponding to the eight trigrams. These eight trigrams are the spirits governing a single day. Humans likewise possess twelve primordial spirits, named the six yin and six yang spirits, which pair with the constructive and protective qi to form the eight trigrams, also governing a single day. Forty-five days comprise three hundred and sixty hours, hence "one *jie*." In three hundred and sixty days, there are eight *jie*.

Ninety days make one *qi* because forty-five days yield the qi of three hundred and sixty spirits, and ninety days yield seven hundred and twenty, hence "one *qi*." In three hundred and sixty days, there are four *qi*. Humans are the same. If one can circulate the constructive, protective, and five viscera qi throughout the body without obstruction, aligning the body’s movement with that of Heaven and Earth, then naturally five days make one *hou*, forty-five days one *jie*, and ninety days one *qi*, perfectly matching the celestial cycles without the slightest deviation.

If one does not understand the movement of Heaven and Earth’s qi cycles and forcibly circulates the true qi within the body’s field, one risks damaging the primordial spirit, leaving the spirit and qi deficient and unable to harmonize with external qi. If one has not damaged the primordial spirit, the spirit and qi remain whole; simply follow this mechanism, aligning with the conjunction of the sun and moon’s qi cycles and precisely adhering to the time, and all will be accomplished. If one has damaged the primordial spirit, one must grasp the root and origin to repair it, replenishing the qi, restoring the spirit, and filling the essence. Then, practicing according to the method, all will be accomplished.

**Determining the Twelve Hours and Dividing the Clepsydra’s Four Symbolic Qi Gathering and Dispersal**

The movement of Heaven and Earth is measured by the clepsydra. To initiate practice and establish positions, the framework of the clepsydra is divided: one day is fixed at one hundred *ke*. Of these hundred *ke*, the four positions of *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you* are each allotted nine *ke*, while the eight positions of *yin*, *shen*, *si*, *hai*, *chen*, *xu*, *chou*, and *wei* are each allotted eight *ke*. Four times nine is thirty-six, and eight times eight is sixty-four, totaling one hundred *ke*, which defines the qi cycles of day and night.

After *wu*, it is the beginning of yin, the initial growth of yin qi. *Mao* is the peak of yang’s flourishing. *Zi* corresponds to the north, the *ren* and *gui* waters, the *Kan* trigram, the Dark Warrior, and the spirit of water.

chunks.original_text: 午者，位合南方丙丁火，卦主高，其象朱雀，火神也。 卯者，位应束方甲乙木，卦主震，其象青龙，木神也。 酉者，位应西方庚辛金，卦主兑，其象白虎，金神也。 此四象者，生成世界，长立乾坤，为天地之主，谓之四象，故於本位，各占九刻。 寅申已亥辰戌丑未，各管八刻，此八者，谓八卦，为四象之辅佐，随四气而行休旺。 ！ 凡行三元正气，须推刻为凭，若一玉刻有差，则真气不能凝给。 且如朔后三十日，是天地气合，以日月运转生成於万物之中，合得天地气候，各逐本性，随顺阴阳变化。 只如人身初受四象真气凝结充实，夺天地造化成人，若不暗合阴阳交感机宜，如何得四象凝结聚成若内外机宜相合，自然从无入有，造化成人，是知人身难得。 今将有质之躯，夺天地阴阳造化，气候性情，往来升降，聚散合刻漏，造化修炼，此理甚易。 且如朔后一日与三十日，癸时太阴真气降来，便将内气与外气相斗。 若不见定刻漏之法则，癸时从何而准定？ 且癸在子后丑前，各以心中为准，此见必有差也。 子管九刻丑，管八刻，但於子后四刻半，即属癸时，太阴真气降来，接气降便取癸后四刻，属丑管，真气聚也，便合丑后四刻，属艮管，其气散也，接散而便运转，次后百刻，准此作用，故天地造化，以刻漏为准则此也。 夺三十日积闰大功章 谓三年之内，有积闰三十日，夺积闰为三十日大功，此法出於三年之外，若到此者，神仙不远。 且为小径之捷利，所言三十日大功者，谓三年内有一闰盖天地造化，气满内有积盛之气，三年内可积三十日， 号曰余闰气。 倍法修功，便将三十日天地气，俱备三百日造化，万象俱全，只如人初受气於母腹中，亦三十日，形体俱备，三百日造化，形象俱t 圆，然后降世为人。 又三年乳哺，可得成形。 若解将此三十日余气，依法而修持，三十日便得真性凝聚，立具灵通，故曰大功。 若此功就，可以坐在立亡，飞灵走圣，入户穿窗，随意立至。 故法曰：须得同道三人，缺一不可为。 缘下功至十五日已后，则真性、欲离於壳也，故须得一人只在於身畔，逐时呼唤，时中定刻漏，逐刻准哺，若或失刻，应是不回也。 何谓？ 本元真性离凡躯壳，然后复醒，当时二气聚日，造化之事，从无入有，以成身形，然后降世，欲效玄机，身法修炼，要作神仙，及降世后，被荣卫气障迷，更不记修身造化机法。 真性既离凡躯，而后复性，身受浊染，恐不回来。 故须一人逐时呼唤，真性既闻人呼唤，知身下功，却又回来。 至二十日已后，逐日真性自现，本形离体，忽有忽无，至二十六日，体象未形，谓之太易，易者合也，方合有无。 至二十七日，元气始萌，谓之太初，初者萌也，初觉有体，至二十八日，形气方端的，谓之太始。 方端的者，直性始具形端。 至二十九日，形体变有质，谓之太素，真形已具於形质，素白而现。 至三十日，真性形质已具，谓之太极。 形质极备，真性脱质成形，往来无障。 到此虽知未达於神仙，实小圣之利便也。 如修此法，须依刻漏为准，所有刻漏法，细分在前。 凡下功处，须是四顾宽容平广，立坛三层，所有坛理，亦分在前。 坛象及定刻图，又目於后，去层坛外定，十二位分，各於本位上依本数定一周，计一百刻，专令一人在坛心坐，逐刻报应，假令春三月甲子日后夜半子时起功， 缘亥管八刻，子管九刻，前三刻又犯荣卫交，正子时又失刻，须是亥后三刻半属子管，子后四刻半又属丑管，丑后四刻又属寅管。

Within three years, there are thirty intercalary days. Seizing these as the "Thirty Days of Great Merit" is a method extending beyond the three-year period. Those who achieve this are not far from attaining immortality. This is a swift and efficacious shortcut.

By doubling the method of cultivation, one can condense thirty days of heaven and earth’s qi into three hundred days of creation, where all phenomena are complete.

One must call out at feeding times, using white paste as the essential ingredient. This white paste is made from the first milk of a woman who has given birth to her first child. For each *sheng* of breast milk, take two *jin* of white sandalwood honey, half a *liang* of musk, one *liang* of cinnabar, half a *liang* of frankincense, and half a *liang* of borneol. Beginning on the day practice commences, consume one spoonful at each of the twelve hours daily. After five days, increase the dose by half a spoonful each day.
